thread.title: Lower Bond Yields, Pause in Dollar Rally Boost Gold

author: David Hodari
title: Lower Bond Yields, Pause in Dollar Rally Boost Gold
text:
Gold prices rose Monday, lifted by a pause in the recent dollar rally and falling Treasury yields.
Front-month gold for February delivery added 0.2% to $1,330.70 a troy ounce on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices have fallen 2.3% after hitting their highest level since August 2016 late last month, weighed down by a rebound in the dollar and concerns about higher interest rates.
